intro: Stenochlaena leptocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stenochlaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels and are often borne on short pedicels. Stenochlaena leptocarpa is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks.
